fr.sii.ogham.html.inliner.impl.regexp

Class CssImageInlinerConstants

    Common constants for inlining of images included through CSS properties (such as background, list-style, ...).

    • Field Detail

      • INLINE_MODE_PROPERTY

        public static final String INLINE_MODE_PROPERTY

        The CSS property name to indicate which strategy for inlining to apply if the default one is not appropriated.

        For example: 
         
        background: url(...);
        --inline-image: base64;
        It forces to use base64 inlining for this image.

        You can also skip inlining by using "skip" value: 

         
        background: url(...);
        --inline-image: skip;

        It is possible to have several images to inline for the same CSS rule. Therefore, you can indicate an inline mode per image: 

         
 .rule {
                background: url('path/to/top.png'), url('path/to/bottom.gif');
                list-style-image: url('path/to/list.gif');
                cursor: url('path/to/cursor.png');
                --inline-image: top=attach bottom=base64 list=skip;
 }
        --inline-image indicates that:
        • Image 'path/to/top.png' should be inlined using attach mode
        • Image 'path/to/bottom.gif' should be inlined using base64 mode
        • Image 'path/to/list.gif' should not be inlined
        As nothing is specified for 'path/to/cursor.png', the default inline mode is used. NOTE: Only the name is provided but you can also target an image by providing any matching path (--inline-image: to/top.png=attach also targets 'top' image). This can be useful if you have several images with the same name but in different folders.
        See Also:
        CssImageInlinerConstants.InlineModes, Constant Field Values

      • INLINED_URL_FUNC

        public static final String INLINED_URL_FUNC
        Property to mark an image as already inlined in order to not process it again
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
